Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed and broad band below frieze; in handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of pairs of satyrs and maenads dancing (from far left, part of satyr, to left; maenad with faded added white arms barely visible, added red fillet and long belted garment with incised vertical fold lines, to right; satyr, to left with right hand raised; maenad, head missing, wearing long belted garment with split skirt, to right; part of satyr (upper body and right leg missing).
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the shape, see Würzburg 428 in Boardman, J., Athenian Black Figure Vases. London, 1974, fig. 184. For the subject, compare the band cup, Athens, Agora P 1241, 'Agora' XXIII, pl. 111, no. 1708.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.55)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 403, no. B600)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0517) (Phase 1)
